Upacara Tungguk Tembakau, Merayakan Keceriaan Petik Panen ‎Petani Tembakau Lereng Merbabu-Merapi
04 Nov 2019, 02:32 by Bambang Arifianto
PUKUL 20.36 WIB, mobil bak terbuka yang kami tumpangi mulai menembus pekat malam. Dengan tenaga yang cukup payah, mobil melaju perlahan menapaki jalanan berkelok dan terus mendaki.
Terpaan angin tak henti-henti menghantam kami yang kedinginan dan meringkuk kedinginan di atas bak terbuka. Rasanya, lebih baik berdiam saja di rumah warga dengan berselimut tebal dan menghangatkan diri dekat perapian ketimbang menjadi santapan terbuka angin pegunungan.
Tapi tunggu dulu, pemandangan indah samar-samar terlihat di kanan kiri kendaraan yang tumpangi. Kami terkepung bayangan hitam dua gunung yang tegak dan membeku di atas ketinggian. 
Dua gunung yang berdiri berdampingan barangkali sejak Pulau Jawa tercipta di muka bumi. Ya, kedua gunung bernama Merapi dan Merbabu ini mempunyai tempat tersendiri dalam tradisi masyarakat Jawa yang tinggal di sekitarnya. Keduanya menjadi pusat orientasi untuk berbagai upacara adat sakral masyarakat setempat. Begitu pula dengan kehadiran kami yang sengaja datang untuk menghadiri Festival Tungguk Tembakau yang berlangsung di Desa Senden, Kecamatan Selo, Kabupaten Boyolali, Provinsi Jawa Tengah Rabu-Kamis, 1-2 Agustus 2018. 
Kami merupakan rombongan jurnalis yang berangkat dari Jakarta menuju Boyolali pada Rabu, 1 Agustus 2018 sore. Menempuh penerbangan selama satu jam, kami tiba di Senden untuk menghadiri peresmian Sekolah Budaya Jawa atau School for Javanese Culture yang digagas sejumlah dosen Fakultas Ilmu Pengetahuan Budaya Universitas Indonesia. Selepas peresmian, kami bergerak menuju lokasi Tungguk Tembakau yang berlangsung di Kompleks Pemakaman Gunungsari. 
Tungguk Tembakau merupakan ritual adat para petani tembakau di lereng Merbabu dan Merapi saat akan melaksanakan petik panen. Selain penanda awal panen, upacara adat itu menjadi bentuk ungkapan rasa syukur dan harapan agar panen berlimpah. Kemeriahan sudah dirasakan kami saat mulai mendekati area pemakaman.
Sebuah panggung melintang di atas jalan dengan tetabuhan gamelan dan tembang jawa mengalun di tengah deru angin yang tak jemu menampar badan kami. Rupanya, Tungguk Tembakau menjadi pesta rakyat di malam itu. Warga Senden dan sekitarnya berduyun datang menikmati pertunjukan tari, gamelan, tembang Jawa yang dipentaskan. Mereka menggelar tikar dan sebagian menghangatkan diri dengan meminum kopi dan merokok di dekat panggung. 
Pukul 21.37, dua gunungan besar sudah mulai digotong dan diarak warga menuju Gunungsari. Dua gunungan tersebut diisi daun tembakau dan sayur-sayuran hasil pertanian warga. Selain dua gunungan besar, terdapat pula dua gunungan kecil kecil berisi lauk pauk makanan.
Dengan perlahan, gunungan-gunungan digotong menuju kompleks pemakaman yang lokasi berada di puncak bukit. Terpaan angin semakin menjadi-jadi sepanjang perjalanan itu. Udara dingin tambah menusuk kendati pakaian dan jaket yang kami gunakan berlapis-lapis. Para penggotong tampak sempoyongan menahan berat beban yang mesti ditanggungnya saat mendaki. 
Dalam kondisi seperti itu, kelakar warga menjadi obat ampuh penahan dingin. Seperti saat sendal seorang warga tertinggal dan mengundang gelak tawa peserta gunungan. Pasalnya, dia harus mencari-cari alas kakinya di tengah gulita malam.



Setelah satu jam perjalanan, kami tiba di Gunungsari. Gunungan dibawa masuk ke sebuah bangunan dengan beberapa makam di dalamnya. Salah satu makam merupakan tempat persemayaman Kyai Syeh Kerto Muhamad, tokoh yang dituakan warga Senden. Beberapa pemuka adat dan pejabat desa masuk ke area makam. Doa-doa pun mengalun bergantian dari mulut mereka.
Seorang pemuka adat lalu keluar menuju ladang tembakau yang mengelilingi kompleks pemakaman. Sang pemuka memetik beberapa daun tembakau yang kemudian disimpan di dekat makam. Gunungan-gunungan pun ikut disimpan di sana selama semalam.
Keesokan harinya, gunungan dikeluarkan dari area pemakaman guna dibagikan ke masyarakat. Warga yang telah menunggu berebut daun tembakau, sayuran, nasi dan lauk pauk yang berada pada gunungan. Keakraban dan keguyuban warga begitu terasa. Mereka berbagi makan serta ceria menghadapi masa panen.
‎Gunungan kemudan diarak kembali ke perkampungan warga. Di sepanjang jalan, warga lain berebut mengambil sisa makanan dan hasil bumi. Sesepuh adat Senden, Purwono mengungkapkan, tradisi Tungguk Tembakau telah berlangsung sejak lama dan merupakan warisan nenek moyang.
"Cuma baru tiga tahun ini diadakan secara massal. Kalau dulu-dulu (merupakan)  acara pribadi setiap warga di ladang masing-masing," tuturnya. Kini, ritual adat petani tembakau lereng Merbabu-Merapi itu dipusatkan di Gunungsari. Menurut Purwono, Tungguk Tembakau merupakan bentuk rasa syukur petani atas karunia tuhan dengan  datangnya musim panen. "Istilahnya kita menjaga kebudayaan," ujarnya. 
Gubernur Jawa Tengah Ganjar Pranowo ikut hadir dalam Festival Tungguk Tembakau. Ganjar bahkan sempat memetik daun tembakau yang diserahkan kepada para pemuka adat ketika gunungan akan diarak ke perkampungan. "Hari ini kita diberikan cuaca yang bagus, insya Allah ini akan memberikan panen yang bagus," ujar Ganjar.
Ganjar menambahkan, kawasan ladang tembakau warga sempat tertutup abu saat erupsi Merapi terjadi pada 1 Juni 2018. ‎ "Yang menarik juga dua kali hujan turun dan itu membersihka debu seperti disiram da dibersihkan tuhan," ucapnya. Tungguk Tembakau, lanjutnya, merupakan cara petani menghormati hasil kerjanya. "‎Dan selalu ada doa yang dipanjatkan agar panen tanamannya bisa hasilnya bagus," ujarnya.***

Tungguk Tobacco Ceremony, Celebrating the Joy of Picking Harvest Merbabu-Merapi Tobacco Farmers Harvest
04 Nov 2019, 02:32 by Bambang Arifianto
AT 20.36 West Indonesia Time, the pickup truck that we were riding in began to break into the thick night. With enough effort, the car drove slowly up the winding road and continued to climb.
The wind did not stop hitting us who were cold and huddled in the open tub. It was better to stay in the people's homes with thick blankets and warm themselves near the fireplace than to be an open meal in the mountain breeze.
But wait, the beautiful scenery vaguely seen on either side of the vehicle that was riding. We were surrounded by the black shadow of two mountains that were erect and frozen above the height.
Two mountains that have stood side by side, perhaps since Java were created on earth. Yes, the two mountains named Merapi and Merbabu have their own place in the traditions of Javanese people who live around them. Both became the center of orientation for various sacred traditional ceremonies of the local community. Likewise with our presence who deliberately came to attend the Tobacco Tungguk Festival which took place in Senden Village, Selo District, Boyolali Regency, Central Java Province Wednesday-Thursday, August 1-2, 2018.
We are a group of journalists who departed from Jakarta for Boyolali on Wednesday, August 1, 2018 in the afternoon. Traveling for an hour, we arrived at Senden to attend the inauguration of the School of Javanese Culture or the School for Javanese Culture, which was initiated by a number of lecturers from the Faculty of Cultural Sciences, University of Indonesia. After the inauguration, we moved to the location of the Tungguk Tobacco which took place in the Gunungsari Cemetery Complex.
Tungguk Tobacco is a traditional ritual of tobacco farmers on the slopes of Merbabu and Merapi when they will carry out harvest picking. In addition to marking the beginning of the harvest, the traditional ceremony is a form of expression of gratitude and hope that the harvest is abundant. The excitement we had felt when we approached the cemetery area.
A stage across the road with the gamelan harbor and Javanese song playing in the middle of the wind that never stopped batting our bodies. Apparently, Tungguk Tobacco became a people's party that night. Residents of Senden and its surrounding areas flocked to enjoy the performance of dance, gamelan, Javanese song that was staged. They spread mats and partly warmed themselves by drinking coffee and smoking near the stage.
At 21.37, two large mountains had begun to be carried and paraded by residents to Gunungsari. The two mountains are filled with tobacco leaves and vegetables from the residents' agriculture. In addition to the two big mountains, there are also two small mountains containing food dishes.
Slowly, the mountains are carried to the cemetery which is on the top of the hill. Exposure to the wind became increasingly intense throughout the journey. The cold air added even though the clothes and jackets we used were layered. The cutters seemed to stagger withstand the weight of the burden that must be borne when climbing.
In such conditions, the citizens' joke becomes a powerful cold-resistant medicine. Like when sandals are left behind by residents and invite laughter of gunungan participants. Because, he had to look for footwear in the middle of the night.



After an hour's drive, we arrived at Gunungsari. Gunungan was brought into a building with several tombs in it. One of the tombs is the abode of Kyai Syeh Kerto Muhamad, a figure who is resident of Senden residents. Some traditional leaders and village officials entered the tomb area. Prayers flow from their mouths in turn.
A traditional leader then goes out to the tobacco fields that surround the cemetery. The leader picked some tobacco leaves which were then stored near the tomb. The mountains are also stored there overnight.
The next day, gunungan was removed from the cemetery to be distributed to the community. Residents who have been waiting for scrambling tobacco leaves, vegetables, rice and side dishes that are in the mountains. Familiarity and community feeling is felt. They share their food and cheerfully face the harvest.
Gunungan and then paraded back to the village residents. Along the way, other residents scramble to take leftovers from food and crops. The Senden traditional elders, Purwono revealed, the Tungguk Tobacco tradition has been going on for a long time and is a legacy from our ancestors.
"It's only been held in three years en masse. In the past (it was) a private event for every citizen in their fields," he said. Now, the traditional rituals of tobacco farmers on the Merbabu-Merapi slopes are centered on Gunungsari. According to Purwono, Tungguk Tobacco is a form of gratitude of farmers for the gift of God with the arrival of the harvest season. "The term we protect the culture," he said.
The Governor of Central Java, Ganjar Pranowo, was present at the Tungguk Tobacco Festival. Ganjar even had time to pick tobacco leaves handed over to traditional leaders when the mountains would be paraded to the village. "Today we are given good weather, God willing, this will provide a good harvest," said Ganjar.
Ganjar added, the residents' tobacco fields had been covered with ashes when the Merapi eruption occurred on June 1, 2018. "What's interesting is that it also rained twice and it cleaned the dust like being doused and cleaned by God," he said. Tungguk Tobacco, he continued, is a way for farmers to respect their work. "And there is always a prayer that is offered so that the crop harvest can be good," he said. ***
